Author: Alright#0419
Content: there is

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that is the consensus level check

Author: Alright#0419
Content: basically if outputs >0 for transparent tx, reject it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: there are a couple checks in AcceptToMemoryPool you need to get rid of to actually get your node to accept the tx, but those aren't consensus rules

Author: Alright#0419
Content: IMO it should be left the way it currently is

Content: 0 sat output t -> t transactions can be useful

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @webworker01 you could do transparent payouts with a bit of work

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do `-connect` to a separate node, change the AcceptToMemoryPool rules on the stratum's node then send transactions with 0 outputs and all the mined blocks as inputs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then when you mine a block, pay each address what you owe them in the coinbase

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that make sense?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: let's say you had 1000 PIRATE, and you need to pay it out to 3 people

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you would change the AcceptToMemoryPool rules on a node that is `-connect`ed to a vanilla node

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then you can send a raw tx using those 1000 transparent coins as inputs and have a single 0 sat output

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then next block it mines, you change the coinbase outputs and pay the miners their shares

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yep

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 🤔 maybe

Author: Alright#0419
Content: hold on

Author: Alright#0419
Content: https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/blob/7ca77757122c74738ecd3c0e3ba6e58e6a4922e4/lib/transactions.js#L126

Author: Alright#0419
Content: obviously don't use this version, but any version of stratum-pool module will have something similar

Content: that's how it adds pool fee addresses

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ah, the whole "pay out miners in the coinbase" thing is horribly insecure

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just realized someone can reorg the block, and take the coins

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well my proposed method of sending a transaction with 0 outputs and using the fees in the coinbase to pay miners

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if you could straight pay the miners in each coinbase, that would work, but that leads to other problems

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I'll show you an example, couple minutes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: but again, it's terribly insecure

Author: Alright#0419
Content: because if you someone reorged the block, they could take the coins

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yea, it's not a good way to do it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well than you can't use the pay miner directly in the coinbase method either

Author: Alright#0419
Content: both would rely on the assumption that the pool will find another block

Author: Alright#0419
Content: as it would have to pay out shares of the previously found block, not the current one

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yep sounds like it
